meanings.definition: To bring bad luck or misfortune to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The black cat crossing your path hoodooed your day.
meanings.sent2: She believed that breaking a mirror would hoodoo her for seven years.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella you opened indoors must have hoodooed your chances of winning the lottery!
meanings.sent4: The cursed amulet seemed to hoodoo all who possessed it.
meanings.sent5: The ancient curse seemed to hoodoo the entire village, bringing endless misfortune.

meanings.sent1: The hoodooed amulet glowed ominously in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The hoodooed house stood abandoned on the hill.
meanings.sent3: The hoodooed potion turned the prince into a frog!
meanings.sent4: The hoodooed spell seemed to have no end in sight.
meanings.sent5: The hoodooed doll's eyes seemed to follow you wherever you went.

meanings.sent1: The hoodooed necklace brought nothing but trouble to its wearers.
meanings.sent2: The hoodooed mirror reflected a distorted image of reality.
meanings.sent3: Every time she wore the hoodooed ring, something went wrong.
meanings.sent4: The hoodooed painting seemed to change its subject when no one was looking.
meanings.sent5: The hoodooed object emitted an eerie aura that made everyone uneasy.
